You will struggle to find anyone at Liverpool who believes that Emre Can’s four-year stay at Anfield will extend beyond May, writes @JamesPearceEcho

It would require the mother of all U-turns for him to agree to the contract extension. The Reds are preparing for him to leave as a free agent. (James Pearce)

The reality is that Can has no great emotional bond keeping him at Anfield and his agent has a history of his players running down their contracts. (James Pearce)

Arguably, Can has much more to lose than Klopp and Liverpool. The arrival of Naby Keita from RB Leipzig this summer will certainly soften the blow for the Reds. (James Pearce)

You will struggle to find anyone at Liverpool who believes that Emre Can’s four-year stay at Anfield will extend beyond May, writes @JamesPearceEcho

It would require the mother of all U-turns for him to agree to the contract extension. The Reds are preparing for him to leave as a free agent. (James Pearce)

The reality is that Can has no great emotional bond keeping him at Anfield and his agent has a history of his players running down their contracts. (James Pearce)

Arguably, Can has much more to lose than Klopp and Liverpool. The arrival of Naby Keita from RB Leipzig this summer will certainly soften the blow for the Reds. (James Pearce)
